bibl.title: Management and Investment on Estates in Roman Egypt during the Early Empire.
bibl.note: The study is an attempt to use the papyrological evidence in order to examine how private landowners in Roman Egypt undertook to exploit their agricultural wealth in an economy subject to severe constraints.
bibl.seg: KEHOE Dennis P., Management and Investment on Estates in Roman Egypt during the Early Empire. (Papyrologische Texte und Abhandlungen. 40.)
Bonn, R. Habelt, 1992, 4Â°, xiv-188 pp. DM 78.

The study is an attempt to use the papyrological evidence in order to examine how private landowners in Roman Egypt undertook to exploit their agricultural wealth in an economy subject to severe constraints.
C.R. par Roger S. Bagnall, BASP 30 (1993) pp. 127-135. - Ann Ellis Hanson, BibO 52 (1995) coll. 406-410. - Dominic W. Rathbone, JRA 7 (1994) pp. 432-436.
